channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flags put up on lampposts, 2nd September
item.description:
A number of flags have appeared tonight around the roundabout and surrounding areas, after one or two were put up a few weeks ago.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Prince John Road, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blatant dog fouling, 2nd September
item.description:
This male allowed his dog to foul a huge amount outside our house right underneath the no dog fouling sign. Grateful for a conversation with an enforcement team as we have clear video of the offence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castledine Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown trees and bins on the pavement, 2nd September
item.description:
Due to overgrown bushes and bins remaining on the pavement, no one is able to pass on the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manordene Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown brambles and thorns on public footpath, 2nd September
item.description:
Footpath that runs between entrances to Aim London north academy STILL has not been addressed. It needs cutting down so people can safely walk the footpath. I have reported it many times along with others. Why is Enfield not being there for its residents. I first reported this before the school Holidays and now they are over and it’s still not been addressed. The area is becoming a dumping group for gas canisters and all sorts. It’s meant to be a public right of way but you can’t push a double buggy or wheelchair safely along the footpath. It runs from vehicle entrance to student entrance. Shocking state that Enfield are allowing the area to become through negligence

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nightingale Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priestlands Park Road, Longlands, London

item.title: Rubbish thrown out of moving window car, 2nd September
item.description:
The car in front of me reg N16PHD make Audi A5 colour gray, threw a plastic bottle out of the passenger window onto pavement. My son 11 and I were both shocked. I have a dash cam and I could try to retrieve the video if required.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northend Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dirty Anerley park, 2nd September
item.description:
Despite being told repeatedly that Veolia are contracted to clean this road TWICE PER WEEK this stretch of road has not been touched in weeks. Same problem areas outside linden court. Dog poo, leaves, rubbish, cans/bottles. Please get it cleaned up and start cleaning it twice per week as we pay for via council tax

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe overcrowding and cleanliness issue on Powell Road, 2nd September
item.description:
A flat there has around 9 people in what seems like a 2 bedroom flat. The smell in the stairway is nauseating (coming from the same flat), rubbish is strewn all over the garden from occupants of the same flat, the bins are overflowing, same flat.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powell Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fire Hazard :- The Builders sent by Greenwich Council to do some work inside 114 Ravens Way, SE12 8EZ have left a lot of building waste including stripped wall papers, and doors and various building waste right on the lawn in front of 114 Ravens Way and this is a Fire Hazard as the items are very flammable., 2nd September
item.description:
Fire Hazard :- The Builders sent by Greenwich Council to do some work inside 114 Ravens Way, SE12 8EZ have left a lot of building waste including stripped wall papers, and doors and various building waste right on the lawn in front of 114 Ravens Way and this is a Fire Hazard as the items are very flammable.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ravens Way, Horn Park, London
